result.execSummary:
The defendant Robyn Kathleen Gravitter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robyn Kathleen Gravitter in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Robyn Kathleen Gravitter in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 8:53 AM. Also called 15CF98. State - both matters are resolved. Scholke - 14CF130 - #1 - amend to 450.11(7)(h) - misd obtaining prescription by fraud - #2 - dismiss and read in - #3 - plead as alleged; 15CF98 - #1 - amend to 450.11(7)(h) - misd. obtaining prescription by fraud - #2 - plead as charged - #3 - dismissed and read in - #4 - amend to misd bail jumping; joint recommendation of 2 years probation with conditions of: fine of $100.00, AODA, absolute sobriety, no possession or alcohol or non-prescribed drugs, no enter into any bars or taverns, 50 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed, conditional jail is free to argue (State will be asking for 120 days) - credit for 14 days on 14CF130 and 7 days on 15CF98 (State stipulates to credit); State - makes correction on amendment and moves to amend as stated by Scholke. Court amends counts as previously stated. Scholke pleads NC to all counts stated in joint agreement by Scholke. Gravitter agrees. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Court reviews complaints. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - recommends 120 days of conditional jail. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - run any jail time concurrent to the jail time she is sitting on a sanction (60 days). State changes his jail recommendation to 60 days - consecutive to the time she is serving now. Gravitter makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence on each count on each case, place on probation for 2 years on all counts - concurrent to each other, $100.00  fine plus costs on #1 in 14CF130 plus costs on all other counts, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no possession of illegal medications, 50 hours of community service - to be completed within first year of probation, 60 days conditional jail on count #1 on 14CF130 - huber allowed consistent with jail rules - consecutive to jail time she is currently serving, take all medication as prescribed and only in the manner in which they are prescribed, credit for 7 days on 15CF98 only if revoked and 14 days credit on 14CF130 only if revoked, right to appeal.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robyn Kathleen Gravitter in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:26 PM. State - believes it is a waiver of PH. Scholke agrees and provides court with waiver of PH form. Court has waiver, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed Information that mirrors complaint. Scholke has Information, filing request for substitution. Court accepts as timely, continues bond.

ADDRESS INFO for Robyn Kathleen Gravitter
Current: W6898 Hwy T, Pearson, WI 54462 United States  (Effective: 07-22-2015)
Prior: 400 West Grant Street, Apt #9, Crandon, WI 54520
No consumption of aclohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

Defendant Robyn Kathleen Gravitter in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:18 PM. State - defendant has another open file that is currently assigned to Judge O'Melia. Scholke has complaint, waives reading, requests PH but will waive time limits, make comment regarding transferring case to Judge O'Melia for judicial economy. Court sets for PH. State - bond - $2000 signature bond, no entry into any bars or taverns and no consumption of alcohol. Scholke has no objections to sig bond. Court - bond - $2000.00 signature bond with no consumption of aclohol and no entry into any bars or taverns. Scholke may have to have another attorney from the same firm cover the PH due to his schedule.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
